sections.heading: Definitions
sections.text: 317.0003 Definitions.—As used in this chapter, the term:

sections.heading: of off-highway vehicle titling laws; records.
sections.text: of off-highway vehicle titling laws; records.

sections.heading: for and issuance of certificate of title.
sections.text: for and issuance of certificate of title.

sections.heading: to issue and authority to cancel a certificate of title.
sections.text: to issue and authority to cancel a certificate of title.

sections.heading: relating to certificates of title; penalties.
sections.text: relating to certificates of title; penalties.

sections.heading: of title; issuance in duplicate; delivery; liens and encumbrances.
sections.text: of title; issuance in duplicate; delivery; liens and encumbrances.

sections.heading: involving vehicle identification numbers, applications, certificates, papers; penalty.
sections.text: involving vehicle identification numbers, applications, certificates, papers; penalty.

sections.heading: without delivery of certificate; operation or use without certificate; failure to surrender; other violations.
sections.text: without delivery of certificate; operation or use without certificate; failure to surrender; other violations.

sections.heading: 317.0001-317.0013 may be cited as the “Florida Off-Highway Vehicle Titling Act.”
sections.text: 317.0001-317.0013 may be cited as the “Florida Off-Highway Vehicle Titling Act.”

sections.heading: As used in this chapter, the term:(1)“ATV” means any motorized off-highway or all-terrain vehicle 55 inches or less in width which has a dry weight of 1,500 pounds or less, is designed to travel on three or more nonhighway tires, and is manufactured for recreational use by one or more persons
